text:
Slide WebDAV Client 2.1b1 does not work fully with Microsoft Exchange Server 
2003. Exchange Server returns <DAV:href> references containing the 
characters '{' and '}', when objects have been created by Outlook Web Access. 
Both characters are declared unsafe by RFC 1738. This has already been reported 
to Microsoft, however Slide 2.1 does not support Microsoft Exchange Server 2003 
at the moment. Slide WebDAV Client as of Version 2.0 is not affected.
creator: steffen.schwark@gmx.de
ib@fiz-chemie.de
text:
Could you give a more detailed explanation of the problem. Especially I don't
see why version 2.0 should not be affected.

The stacktrace is:

Caused by: org.apache.commons.httpclient.URIException: escaped absolute path 
not valid
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI.setRawPath(URI.java:2781)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI.parseUriReference(URI.java:1973)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpURL.%3Cinit%3E(HttpURL.java:78)
	at org.apache.webdav.lib.WebdavResource.setWebdavProperties
(WebdavResource.java:1060)
	at org.apache.webdav.lib.WebdavResource.setNamedProp
(WebdavResource.java:968)
	at org.apache.webdav.lib.WebdavResource.setBasicProperties
(WebdavResource.java:912)
	at org.apache.webdav.lib.WebdavResource.listBasic
(WebdavResource.java:2115)
  [...]

We debugged into the code and found that the client requested the elements of a 
collection named "http://<server>/public/Activities/". Exchange returned an 
element named "http://<server>/public/Activities/{75F88904-E009-4F6B-AB39-
9F83D12BA3A8}.EML" which the client tried to convert into a HttpUrl object. 
Probably the checks in either the Slide WebDAV client 2.1b or the utilized 
HttpClient are stricter than in Version 2.0.
creator: steffen.schwark@gmx.de

text:
IMHO, this is a non-bug. It is perfectly possible to work with those URLs via
Slide Client 2.1 (PROPPATCH it etc) if you mask 'em (%7B and %7D). Please do not
"fix" this bug, my code relies on this behavior. Works like a charm. 

Work around it by masking your URLs instead - tested with Exchange Server 2003
creator: ralph.scheuer@gmx.net
steffen.schwark@gmx.de
text:
I don't know if it is a bug according to the RFC spec. But it definitely is an 
incompativility problem with Microsoft Exchange, if listBasic() answers with 
an URIException upon listing a collection. I can't mask the problematic 
characters because I never get to see the URL before the exception is thrown.

Hi,

I ran into the same problems using just two lines:
WebdavResource wdr = new WebdavResource(... url to my exchangeserver/myid/Calendar)
wdr.getChildResources()

Webdavclient-OS is Linux running Blackdown or IBM JDK 1.4.2/02 Server is of
course Exchange 2003
creator: elwood@agouros.de
